content.raw:
Existing tests account for this in the sense that they do not run in semi-supervised mode, this fix is to prevent the error which I believe always occurs when running identify in semi-supervised mode. Do you mean why is the option being passed even when not in semi-supervised mode? It could be changed so it is only passed if in semi-supervised mode, because otherwise -1 is the default value anyway, but the complication is that the option needs to be passed even if train but not identify was run in semi-supervised mode, as seen in the steps to reproduce the error from issue #6:

1. segway train --semisupervised

2. segway identify
content.html:
Existing tests account for this in the sense that they do not run in semi-supervised mode, this fix is to prevent the error which I believe always occurs when running identify in semi-supervised mode. Do you mean why is the option being passed even when not in semi-supervised mode? It could be changed so it is only passed if in semi-supervised mode, because otherwise -1 is the default value anyway, but the complication is that the option needs to be passed even if train but not identify was run in semi-supervised mode, as seen in the steps to reproduce the error from issue #6:

  1. segway train --semisupervised

  2. segway identify
